H055.name: Price Oscillation Before Settlement
H055.conclusion: High-oscillation markets have WORSE edge than low-oscillation at same prices

H061.name: Large Market Inefficiency
H061.conclusion: No significant difference between high and low volume markets

H047.name: Resolution Time Proximity Edge Decay
H047.conclusion: Edge difference is entirely due to different price levels in early vs late trades

H059.name: Gambler's Fallacy After Streaks
H059.conclusion: Slight mean reversion effect but not actionable for trading

H048.name: Category Efficiency Gradient
H048.temporal_stability: UNCERTAIN - only 6 markets in second half
H048.conclusion: PROMISING but not validated due to small sample, needs more data

H066.name: NCAAFTOTAL Totals Betting
why_not_validated: Most data from Dec 5-8 (bowl game season)
May be specific to bowl games vs regular season
H066.action: MONITOR - collect more data before implementing

key_findings: 4 of 5 Priority 2 hypotheses are REJECTED (price proxies or weak effects)
NCAAFTOTAL shows strong edge (+22.5%) but needs more data for validation
Price proxy check is CRITICAL - most apparent signals disappear when controlling for price
The Kalshi market remains highly efficient for simple strategies
S007 (Leverage Fade) from Session 008 remains the ONLY validated non-price-based strategy
recommendations: Implement S007 (Leverage Fade) as the primary non-price-based strategy
Continue collecting NCAAFTOTAL data during regular season
If NCAAFTOTAL edge persists with 200+ markets, consider adding as S008
Do NOT implement H055, H061, H047, H059 - all rejected
Focus research effort elsewhere - Priority 2 hypotheses exhausted
